results.title: Gungarri woman
results.creator_credit: Linda Wordie and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.
results.description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.

results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: It was government policy for First Nations peoples in Australia to assimilate to the white ethics of education and work. Then came the mission stations, removal of children, forced labour often in the most deplorable conditions, exploitation and even when First Nations Australians were trained in skilled work through the mission stations, white Australians would not employ them - all this most comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film.
results.title_for_label: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History

group.title: Another day, another dollar: three short films about the history of work

group_siblings.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
group_siblings.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions

group_siblings.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
group_siblings.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions

results.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
results.brief_description: ‘Projected memories: work in old films’. In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.
results.description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: Alice Jackson Walsh and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

results.title: The Village green
results.brief_description:
Vietnamese poet Huong Trieu worked with ACMI to produce a visual treatment of her poetry about village life in Vietnam. This was part of a VicHealth funded initiative.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Wise woman
results.creator_credit: Hannan Kuea and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Hannan’s grandmother was a wise woman and a great storyteller who would tell Hannan ghost stories as a young girl in Sudan. This story was produced in association with the Craig Family Centre and funded by VicHealth.

results.title: Culture, respect and law
results.brief_description: Collin Walker Snr, a Yorta Yorta elder, tells of mission life and living in Echuca. This story was produced in one of ACMI’s regional workshops conducted in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation and funded by VicHealth.
